answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!You must look at various causes of obesity—rich diet, lack of exercise, adrenal gland problems, hypothyroid state, diabetes etc. In females polycystic disease of the ovary is another cause. A good nutrition specialist and fitness instructor can help you get your body back on track.Read through this link. It may be of help: http://win.niddk.nih.gov/publications/understanding.htm#othercausesBasically following the various tests for a pathological cause of obesity, you need a life style change.Hope this helps. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I am a thirty year old mother of three that has been very healthy up until 3 years ago.I have suffered from extreme swelling and weight gain.I have weighed 100 pounds since a teenager.I am only 4' 10'.  Now I am 175 pounds.All weight has been gained in the past 2 years.I am currently taking atenolol for high blood pressure and irregular heartbeat.I was biten by a tick 4 years ago and was deathly sick. Doctors said Lymes Disease. (hope my spelling is correct)From time to time the lymph nodes on the side of my neck will swell. title: Extreme swelling and weight gain
